title: It's easy to criticize, hard to create; my motto is never give up, says Henrik Fisker
content: Fisker admitted that while the auto industry might be the hardest to succeed, the nascent EV industry is even more difficult. But he is personally “excited about doing great work in this industry and bringing new innovative EVs to the world”. Charging infrastructure is in the early stages of becoming as reliable as gas fueling systems. Other challenges on the manufacturing front, development cost, government policies also exist.

title: Proactive cybersecurity: The achilles heel of the EV ecosystem
content: Given EVs' interconnected nature and reliance on local power grids, a new set of risks is created for drivers, companies and infrastructure. This makes it critical for all organisations within the EV ecosystem to adopt a preventive security approach to get ahead of threat actors and deliver secure vehicles and infrastructure.

title: Altair and ARAI signs MoU to advance technology and digital transformation goals
content: Altair and ARAI signed an MoU to leverage digital twin tech, data-driven design, and AI solutions, enhancing electrification, connectivity, and energy management. Leaders Stephanie Buckner and Reji Mathai noted ARAI's testing benefits. Altair's advanced simulation and data analytics will integrate into ARAI’s consulting, promoting AI-driven engineering, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable R&D processes.

title: ZF’s ‘flexible’ approach to bring in global technology innovations

title: Michelin collaborates with DPIIT to launch the Michelin AI Startup Challenge
content: Michelin and DPIIT launch the AI Startup Challenge in India. Officials including Shri Sanjiv, Shri Sumeet Kumar Jarangal, Dr Ambica Rajagopal, and Shri Shantanu Deshpande attended. Hosted on the Startup India portal, startups receive mentorship, INR 5 lakh for paid pilot projects, and potential global contracts. Shri Rajesh Kumar Singh highlighted demos set for September 2024.

title: Ola has exited Google Maps, moved to in-house navigation system: Bhavish Aggarwal
content: Bhavish Aggarwal, cofounder of Ola Cabs, said the company will now use its in-house navigation system, exiting Google Maps. This comes a month after Ola took its IT workload off Microsoft Azure.  The ride-hailing company will add features, including street view, neural radiance fields, indoor images, 3D maps and drone maps to Ola Maps, Aggarwal said in a post on X.

title: Altair and Metrics collaborate to redefine semiconductor design verification
content: Metrics' DSim, when integrated with Altair’s tools, will offer an advanced simulation environment featuring superior simulation and debug capabilities. title: Mercedes-Benz Research and Development India collaborates with BITS Pilani for advanced technology research
content: The partnership is centered on breakthroughs in the mobility sector, exploring and developing advanced technologies. title: Autonomous car rules advancing faster than the vehicles themselves: UN
content: Fully autonomous cars are still years away from hitting the streets, but internationally-agreed rules on their use could be ready by mid-2026, the United Nations has said. Furthermore, "we are planning to have a globally harmonised regulation on Automated Driving Systems (ADS) ready for mid-2026", he said.

title: Explainer: What's behind Volkswagen's USD 5 billion EV software bet on Rivian?
content: The tie-up is the latest in a string of deals by Volkswagen Chief Executive Oliver Blume, who took over in September 2022 after the ousting of Herbert Diess.
